Reviews.Title: Edited Review - Battery Door Problem
Reviews.Author: Stephen G. Ayres
Reviews.Content: It is with regret that I must edit my review on the Nikon L24.Because of a weak design on the battery cover door I cannot recommend this camera.  However, I am leaving the original review below this addition because everything I originally wrote about the operation still stands.  The 1-star rating I'm now leaving reflects the inadequate closure design and Nikon's refusal to replace the battery cover under warranty.The battery door cover on mine broke just like the others who have written about the L20 / L24 series Nikon cameras.  My defect made itself known to me after 6 months of use.  There was never any abuse, no drops, no bumps, camera was kept in a case except when I was taking or transferring pictures.The lip on the inside of the battery door gave way as I was taking a picture - the door popped open and the batteries dropped at my feet.  It took me a minute or two with reading glasses to see exactly what happened and where the breakage/weakness was.For those interested, I have close-up pictures of the broken area and they can be seen on this page:[..link removed..]When I contacted Nikon about this, I was instructed to send in the camera for evaluation.  I did (it was worth a $6 gamble).  After they got the camera, I was told that the repair would cost approximately $50.  I replied back stating that I felt that it was a design flaw and that the repair should be covered under warranty.  In a subsequent reply, I was told that the issue is not repairable under warranty but the repair itself would be warrantied for 6 months in case another similar failure occurred.I chose to NOT pay $50 to repair a $100 camera and will attempt a repair myself later.  In the meantime, I'll tape the door closed with electrical tape.Again...*** I cannot recommend the purchase of this camera due to the weak design of the battery door ***.  The cover is under constant pressure from the battery springs and the design of the plastic lip is inadequate to take this pressure.My advice to existing owners whose cameras have not broken YET is to take the pressure off of the poorly designed door that is subject to breaking by stretching a piece of good-quality electrical tape to secure the door.Other than the flimsy battery door design, this IS a good camera.  Nikon really should be covering this repair under warranty and I'll be sure the check for similar design flaws if I ever consider another Nikon camera purchase.--------------------------------------------Original review below--------------------------------------------Disclaimer:  This particular review isn't being written from an avid photographer's point of view.I needed a small, inexpensive, good-quality, easy-to-use camera for my job.  My main use for this camera is taking good, clear indoor before/after photos of various electronic devices and related components.  My requirements are a large LCD viewer, the ability to use common AA batteries, have my settings (date/time, photo mode) retained after batteries were removed and replaced, and a quick way to transfer images to my PC's that doesn't rely solely on a USB cable.Preferring not to have to deal with camera angle or cumbersome tricks to reduce flash reflection from shiny surfaces, I was hoping to find something that would allow effective non-flash settings where a semi steadily-held camera could take clear, acceptable indoor pictures as required by the companies that I do work for.As much as I tried, I could not get good, consistent results with the e510 but I seem to have found that camera with the L24.So far with the L24, I've taken pictures of HDTV televisions (displays powered both on and off), PCB boards, product labels, macro shots of venting capacitors, etc. - *all without flash*, using only ambient room lighting.For me, time is an important factor and with these onsite job shots, I do not have the time or desire to do pre-shot adjustments or after-processing like resizing, gamma-tweaking, or cropping.  The shots I take need to be ready to be attached to an email or be uploaded to technician portals.  The settings that I have found that work for me is the  "white balance" and "motion detect" set for auto, resolution set for 1024x768 (for email-ready small file and dimension), and flash set for "off".As long as my subjects aren't in the shadows, the camera is held relatively steady, and the images framed properly, my pictures are clear and all I have to do once I return home is transfer to my PC, attach and send.  The settings as described above allow clear pictures for my uses in both regular and macro modes.The camera remembers my settings with its AA batteries out and its 3" LCD viewer lets me verify a good shot (they've all been pretty good so far).Connectivity:All of my PC's have a card slot that accommodates the SD type, so if the included UC-E6 cable isn't handy, I remove the SD card from the camera and transfer images that way.  If I needed more of these cables, I can get them for $4 each on eBay.You don't have to use a SD card (camera has 17MB built-in) but I do recommend using a card for the extra storage and image-transfer/connectivity options.When buying a SD card, consider the card-reading compatibility with your existing equipment if you intend on using using the card to transfer images.  Some card readers do not read SDHC (high-capacity) cards, I was aware of this potential compatibility issue beforehand and bought a standard SD 2GB (not a SDHC) card.I'm sure once more people buy this camera, more features than I covered will be discussed.  There are settings on the L24 that I will probably never use.  In my quick tour through the menu settings (haven't read the manual yet - haha) I didn't see where you can manually adjust aperture or shutter speed independently but there is an exposure control.  The lack of manual settings might be a minus for serious photographers but like I said before, photography isn't a hobby for me - I just want to take good pictures easily and quickly.

Reviews.Title: Good Compact Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Sean Ng
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for quick access during vacation and travel. Although the camera cannot zoom very far it still is a very good camera. Takes very clear pictures and can be slipped into your pockets very easily into my pocket. Transferring pictures is very easy just hook up the camera into the computer and click the you want and drag to the desktop. The only problem i have with the camera is that it has a hard time focusing on small texts. For example i want to copy a receipt and send it to the manufacturer it would come out blurry.Overall this is a great camera and i would highly recommend this for travel or for quick takes

Reviews.Title: Garbage!
Reviews.Author: Shuttlcapt
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for my daughter. One month later, the battery compartment door retention pins break, rendering the unit useless and there was no way to close the door-not even with tape. I learned of this in July as she was away at school, but it is 'guaranteed' for 1 year! Yay!  I followed Nikon's directions to return to them. They advised me that they did not consider this covered as it was possible we may have dropped it or forced the door closed. I calmly explained that wasn't the case AND that we had a friend with the same camera and same problem!  ALSO, you can read the reviews of this camera on various sites (or the L-22) to see that it's a common gripe.  They would not fix it and wanted $93. After the postage/insurance to ship it to them, I could buy a new camera. But I  will not ever buy another Nikon product. I am sticking with Canon as they have covered their product for me in the past OUT of warranty!!! You've been warned.

Reviews.Title: Terrific photos, easy to use
Reviews.Author: Scott Clines
Reviews.Content: Although I haven't used all its features yet, I love this camera! The photos are sharp and clear, and it is so easy to use that I just took it out and started shooting. If I could post just one of my dragonfly photos in which you can see every vein in their wings there could be no doubt as to the quality of the photos. My 75 year old father saw how easy it is to use and the quality of the photos and asked me to get one for him. QED  Four stars, though, because the auto focus when using the macro function has difficulty focusing on objects that do not take up enough of the field of vision. It could use a manual focus or an easier way to manipulate the auto-focus.

Reviews.Title: Same story as others!!!!!  Broken battery door latch!
Reviews.Author: Berlin Traveller
Reviews.Content: I didn't see that others were having the same problem until today.  I didn't have the camera a month when the battery door latch broke.  I finally got around to sending it in for repair, knowing that it would be covered on the warranty.  But today I received the bill for the repair--$73.30 for the repair since it's NOT covered by the warranty.  What a joke!So I decided to warn others--and then I see all these reviews from folks with the same problem.  You'd think that Nikkon would admit that it was a faulty design problem so that they don't lose customers.  I'll never go back to a Nikkon!

Reviews.Title: nikon junk
Reviews.Author: G&C
Reviews.Content: I purchased the camera to take on a vacation.  After six months, the small plastic latch on battery compartment broke.  I had to tape it closed which was a huge inconvenience if I wanted to remove the card or needed to change batteries.  Even worse, as I attempted to get assistance from Nikon, they wanted to see the camera without talking about it.  Well after $11.00 to return to Nikon, I quickly received an email saying they would need about $100 to repair and return.  The latch was not covered under their warranty.  They could have told me that and I would have saved the shipping costs.  Either way, I will not be purschasing anything Nikon and I will tell anyone who listens that Nikon is NOT the camera to buy.

Reviews.Title: Pictures are fine but...
Reviews.Author: BG "BG"
Reviews.Content: I bought this last week. It takes very nice pictures and very user friendly. My 70 year old dad can find his way around the camera. Trouble is dropped it while teaching him. It was only a 2 ft drop but that broke the latch on the battery door. Searching online found several remedies of how to fix it but none that would please you aesthetically.Too flimsy is my complaint. Looks like several of Nikon s cameras have had that problem. Although couldnt find any other posts except one right on this page about the battery door problem for this model.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME camera!
Reviews.Author: Cheri Bo Beri "FLGACabinetsTileAndTops.com"
Reviews.Content: Replacement camera for an HP with 5MP (old!) that I dropped in the water...this camera is used for work and personal and works so well and takes the absolute BEST pics--easy to use too!!!

Reviews.Title: coolpix not so cool
Reviews.Author: mamadog
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a summer vacation.  (My daughter had a Coolpix and had trouble with the camera's battery door not closing.  I thought it was just a fluke.) The very first day I used my camera on vacation, the battery door would not close.  Upon looking at it closely, it seemed a small piece of plastic was broken.  I had to tape the door shut for the remainder of my trip.  When I returned, I sent the camera back and bought a different brand.  It is a great small camera and ease of use is wonderful - price is right as well!  However, I read other reviews that stated a similar problem with the battery door.  Once this breaks, the only fix is to buy a new camera.

Reviews.Title: fantastic little camera!
Reviews.Author: Grandma Dottie
Reviews.Content: I absolutely adore this camera!  I am by no means a photographer, but I get sharp clear photos from this camera.  It is very easy to use, small enough to slip into my purse, and, besides that, it is a great-looking little camera.  I am 82 years old now, but because of this camera, I can still take snapshots of anything and everything that intrigues me!

Reviews.Title: Terrific point & shoot camera
Reviews.Author: Chuck
Reviews.Content: My wife needed a new camera and doesn't like complicated things. Her learning curve on this camera was only about 10 minutes and she loves the quality of the pictures and the fully automatic mode. A good choice for easy pictures!

Reviews.Title: Love it!!!
Reviews.Author: rachel
Reviews.Content: Well, I recieved this order 3 days sooner than they said to expect it. It came in the same box you would have recieved had you bought it at a Best Buy or other electronic store. It is beautiful, easy to use, and the pictures are phenominal. I had an older Coolpix model from 2008 but this camera is so much nicer... 14 megapixels, and it runs on AA batteries. Overall, Im in love with this camera. Not to mention the red one (the one that i bought) is $20-30 less than if you were to buy in store. Also, just a tip, if you do buy this camera be sure to buy a memory card, the actual camera has hardly any memory at all. Im fortunate to have kept mine from my last camera. Anyhow, I reccomend this camera. Nikon is (in my opinion) the best camera company out there, I have used their cameras for personal/recreational and business use. This is an amazing camera for an inexpensive price. I would recomend this product to any of my friends and/or family members. A truely awesome camera... <3 I love it.

Reviews.Title: Battery door broke in 35 days...
Reviews.Author: Russ Whaley
Reviews.Content: Battery door latch is broken - 35 days after order - and we have to tape the door shut to get a picture.  Pictures are pretty decent... however, if the latch comes loose while the picture is being taken - it corrupts the SD card.  If you tape the door shut, it takes good pictures and videos.  You do need to turn on the vibration reduction.  So... anyone know how to get warranty work on this camera?  There is no info on the Amazon site and since our door broke 5 days after our "30 day" return policy - I guess we are on our own.  So, if you are thinking about this camera - buyer beware... hopefully if you have trouble it will be within the "30 day" return window.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: tj3193
Reviews.Content: The quality of pictures is excellent.  It is very easy to use.  I would recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Disappointment...
Reviews.Author: Casca
Reviews.Content: I have owned other Nikon cameras in the past. I was considered the quality of the pictures to be very good. This camera, however, is terrible... The pictures are very blurred... It seems that the algorithm responsible for controlling the flashlight does not work properly... Maybe it might be a "settings" issue... But the fact is that I did not make any significant changes in the factory settings... Moreover, I don't think that one should be required to be a photography expert to use this kind of camera... In summary, I was on vacation and just bought the camera and used it for day to day photos. And the results were terrible!

Reviews.Title: Bit of a let down
Reviews.Author: Aiden
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews before deciding on this camera, I bought to replace a very old Sony Cybershot, which while still functioned well, I felt it was time to update, and being that I was going on vacation, I wanted something newer.  Big mistake!Overall the camera is easy to use, the manual is not very informative or helpful.  The menu is easy enough to navigate, but the actual function of the camera is very limited.  It takes ok pics in the most ideal situations (ie perfect lighting ), the flash is beyond disappointing, and no matter how I tried to adjust it, I could not get my desired affect.  The zoom on the camera was not bad, and it was easy to use.  I did find a lot of lag in some settings, and the biggest issue was that it was very hard to hold the camera still, and if you don't the pictures are a complete blur.  Overall I was very unhappy with the performance of this camera.  I ended up deleting half the photos I took because the quality was so bad.  The photos I did keep are also not so great, color and clarity were very poor.I have to say I expected much more from Nikon, and probably will not purchase any other products from them.

Reviews.Title: Nikon failure
Reviews.Author: MO
Reviews.Content: Within one week the battery door broke.  Three months later, the first week I really used it while on vacation, it died completely.  I changed the batteries, but it never turned back on again.  The cost of repair is more than the camera.  I hate to say, I wasted over $100 and have no recourse.  I bought a Sony Cybershot while on vacation and love it.

Reviews.Title: This camera is fool's gold.
Reviews.Author: Jesus B Reyes
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the reviews. I have owned many cameras from expensive to affordable ones and this is one of the worst economic cameras I have used. I will be returning it today after 3 days of use. The camera build feels cheap and the delay in the execution of the camera shoot and picture reviews is long and annoying, regardless of camera settings and room lighting. There are plenty of affordable cameras out there that are not as bad as this one.

Reviews.Title: Good little camera
Reviews.Author: W. Shattuck
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for vacation, and all the pictures are good.  Very Easy point and shoot.  I have not tried anything fancy with it, and probably won't.  It is easy to operate and easy to view.  The only down side is having to purchase a separate memory card (it does not come with one).  But that was noted in the description and I was not surprised.  Good overall camera.

Reviews.Title: Poor suport from Nikon
Reviews.Author: Jonah Smith
Reviews.Content: I purchased the nikon coolpix as a gift for my wife. Just before the warranty ran out the screen on the camera went blank and wouldn't work.  We contacted Nikon and sent it back for repair under warranty.  when we got it back a month or so later the screen was on but was out of focus and you couldn't clearly see the subject. It seemed to take pictures OK but we couldn't even view the pictures we had taken because the screen was too blurry.  My wife was scheduled to go out of town to visit kids/grand kids in a few weeks and wanted to take the camera with her.  We contacted Nikon again and was told that it would be fine to return the camera after she got even though the original warranty was expired they would take care of the repair because the hadn't fixed right the first time.  When she returned we sent it back again and after another month or so we got a call from Nikon and was told that it was no longer under warranty.  I went great detail to voice my complaint and was told by the rep she would need to discuss it with the supervisor and would get back to me.  Another month want by. Nikon called and said the repair was about $100. and the best they would do is fix it for half price. Needless to say I told them to shove it! They sent me the broken camera back.  At this point I don't care if Nikon makes the best camera in the world, their service sucks.  I will never purchase another Nikon product. And I will jump at every chance I get to tell my story about Nikons crappy warranty service. I will also be filing a complaint with the Better Business Bureau.

Reviews.Title: great pocket camera
Reviews.Author: Blaine
Reviews.Content: The Nikon Coolpix L24 is a great pocket camera for when I don't want to carry my Nikon D3100 SLR with all the lenses.  I got the L24 to replace my Nikon Coolpix L4 which finally failed after years of use and over 100,000 images taken. The L24 is a nice upgrade to 14 megapixels for not a lot of cash.

Reviews.Title: Great little point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Crazy Horse
Reviews.Content: This is a great point and shoot for almost any application except long distance. Great for parties and social events. Cannot shoot across a large room because the flash and lens cannot handle distance. If you want to photograph your child at the school awards ceremony you better be in the front row if you use this camera. It is a good camera for its intended use.Nikon COOLPIX L24 14 MP Digital Camera with 3.6x NIKKOR Optical Zoom Lens and 3-Inch LCD (Red)

Reviews.Title: Worked nicely for a week, but WAY too delicate
Reviews.Author: Porc
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera at a Target for a trip and it's worked fairly well... EXCEPT it's just way too delicate.This camera fell from a tabletop to a carpeted floor (about 2' - 2.5') and the pin that holds the battery door closed sheared off.  Currently, I have the door held shut with a piece of tape.Yea, it fell, but 2' onto carpet?  That's just shoddy construction.

Reviews.Title: Very Disappointed
Reviews.Author: lawlady
Reviews.Content: I am not a professional but I am an avid picture taker and I am pretty knowledgeable about digitalm cameras.  I did alot of research and chose this camera because it was simple without alot of frills and buttons AND best of all, it works on AA batteries.  I was hunting for a new camera for my 75 year old mother who would actually prefer to have her old 35 mm camera back.  My mom needs a simple point and shoot that will take consistent pictures and takes batteries she won't have to worry about charging or keeping track of a charging cord.  She is going on a vacation and on her last trip, she kept forgetting to charge her camera batteries.  I thought this camera fit all of my requirements but the picture taking is inconsistent.I tried the camera out first and kept the camera primarily in Easy Auto Mode so that I would not have to fool with changing the scene modes but the flash was inconsistent.  The flash only worked about a third of the time so the indoor pictures were not always good.  I read the manual but can't figure out why the flash was inconsistent.  The outdoor pictures were good but on the longest zoom, the pictures were blurry.When the flash worked (indoors) and the longest zoom wasn't used (outdoors)the pictures were awesome and made me think great camera! But like I said, this was not consistent- even when I took pictures of the same thing back to back.  Also, I put a high speed memory card in the camera but the camera still took anywhere from 3 to 7 seconds to recover from a picture and it was frustrating waiting to take the next picture.  And, in auto mode, the camera would sometimes take longer to adjust itself.  But I will say that when the camera did take a longer time to adjust, the pictures came out very nice.  And, when I changed the scene modes and exposures and megapixels, I was able to change the quality of the pictures.All in all, I had high hopes for this camera based on the great reviews and the features this camera but I was disappointed when the camera did not perform as hoped.  My mom is not at all technological and she would get frustrated with trying to figure this camera out.  She is not going to adjust scenes and modes and just needs a simple point and shoot that preferrably uses regular batteries.This is not the camera I hoped.

Reviews.Title: Good Little Camera with a Serious Defect
Reviews.Author: David E Hiett
Reviews.Content: Like others who have reviewed this camera, my battery door broke after only 3 months and now even gorilla tape barely keeps it together.  This makes the camera virtually worthless.  Having read others who have had bad experiences with Nikon and their refusal to stand by their camera on this subject, I will junk it and get another one.  NOT a Nikon Coolpix though. Unforunately, it is otherwise a good camera, but with the battery door flopping open at random it is useless.

Reviews.Title: Not misty water colored any more!
Reviews.Author: Ghost writer "chelli8"
Reviews.Content: MEMORIES!!!!!We have finally gotten a great point and shoot that gives clear photos, anyone in the family can use it (i think we can somehow teach the cats... maybe Ashton has some ideas) and it is so small and light it fits in a pocket or purse with ease.  Also my wallet was happy because it didn't cost an arm and a leg to get a great camera.  We debated and read the reviews of this versus the canons, but my friend who is a photographer was always enamored with Nikon products since in high school and she depends on them 25 years later for her mortgage and food.  So we went with the Nikon.We took this on vacation and with an extreme 10 class 16GB card we had over 3000 photos to take at 14MP or get this over 10000 at PC resolutions!!!!  We took pictures of EVERYTHING on our trip.  We took multiple shots we snapped it all and then edited it all deleting the spoiled shots and keeping the amazing ones that make our vacation look amazing.  Our memories are frozen for us and we can clearly recall everything in the shots with clarity.  The faces were auto focused.  There were settings for all the environments we encountered.  We even got shots of the amazing fireworks we saw several of the nights.It was great to have a real camera on our trip to record our moments.Thanks Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Good basic starter digital.
Reviews.Author: M. Ma
Reviews.Content: The Pros:---------Compact: about the size of a deck of cards/pack of cigarettes.Easy to use. I was taking my first picture within seconds of putting new batteries in it.Easy batteries: Takes 2xAA (one pair) which you can buy anywhere plus it has 3 different battery (Li-Ion, NiMH, Alkaline) settings though I don't know how much difference it makes.Price: reasonably priced for a basic camera.Some nice extra features: Image stabilization (first one in the Coolpix L2x series to have it)Night/firework/food/etc. modes.=========The Cons:---------Slow.Note I have a high-speed SDHC (class 10) card.Slow powerup: 7-9 seconds from the time you press the power button before you can take a picture. (tried different shooting settings, different SD cards, different battery types, flash on/off). Ads and manual say 2-3 seconds, unless I have a defective model this is NOT the case.Slow high-speed mode. Sports mode is about 1 second between shots and too slow to be practical.Slow standard photos (set for 3MP) mode still take a good couple of seconds between shots in good lighting.3.6x optical zoom (in an era of 14x)640x480 movies (most others are HD 1080/720.)Overall:========A good compact basic starting digital camera with a few features you normally don't see in a budget model.If you want HD, faster shooting, zoom, etc...you'll have to pay a bit more and look elsewhere.I've seen other cameras with a few more features, higher zooms (Olympus 7030 has 7x) in the same price point...but none of them use AA's.If you don't need image stabilization the previous models are almost identical (L22, L20, etc...) and can be had for half the price at the time of this review.

Reviews.Title: Horrible Purchase
Reviews.Author: footballmom9
Reviews.Content: I purchased two of these cameras and had the same problem with both.  They take pretty good pictures when they are working but both cameras had problems with the screens.  Both developed black splotches on the screens that prevented you from seeing anything that you were taking a picture of.  The pictures come out fine but you can't see what you're photographing.

Reviews.Title: Shutter speed way to slooooow  ):
Reviews.Author: paula owens
Reviews.Content: I thought buying anything Nikon would be safe...I was wrong...The Coolpix L24 looks nice...but with it's extremely slow shutter speed,you or your subject better not breathe or it blurs...Extremely disappointed...Plan on returning it...

Reviews.Title: good camera but the battery door is defective
Reviews.Author: Sara
Reviews.Content: Good little camera, but we are one of the many who had the battery door break. I think it's time for Nikon to admit thier error. Buy another camera.

Reviews.Title: Nice & smooth transaction
Reviews.Author: Manuel Bran
Reviews.Content: All Nikon cameras are good and this is not the exception, for the price was a good buy.The only thing is that the batteries compartment is a little fragile, you must to be careful when open it.The camera takes good pictures and videos; I love the face recognition feature that is nice!The transaction was crystal clear.They sent the item just was offered.I love my new Nikon camera. I'll recommend it.

Reviews.Title: BE AWARE THAT THE DOOR LATCH FAILS
Reviews.Author: Diane Gauthier
Reviews.Content: I have enjoyed this camera for approximately two years. However, just THIS WEEK, the door latch (which holds the SD card and batteries) has failed. A smallish portion of plastic is broken away, and this little piece is essential to keeping the door shut and the batteries in place. Now I have to use extreme pressure and some tape to hold everything in place in order to take a photo. I'm really disappointed in this. If anyone knows of a fix, please reply.

Reviews.Title: one of the slowest auto focus cameras I have ever used
Reviews.Author: username_5
Reviews.Content: This isn't a camera I would have been interested in, but my wife got it as a gift and I thought it would be great for her.  She had been using a few year old hand down camera I gave her and I thought that any modern camera would be a step up from that one.  I was wrong.I could give a more comprehensive review of the issues with this camera, but it's a sub $100 camera so I will just point out the most significant flaw of this camera from my perspective.  A flaw that many other cameras in this class do not have.After my wife took 50 or so pics she asked me to get them off the camera and onto her computer.  Typically what I do is put them on my computer first, cull the obviously terrible pics and then do some light editing of the rest (crop, rotate, straighten, color correct).  I ended up deleting about half of them because they were so out of focus the subject was unrecognizable.With her previous camera there was the occasional really out of focus pic, but with the L24 around half were.  Curious as to why this would be I grabbed her camera and started playing with it.  That's when I saw the fatal flaw with this camera.  It's auto focus is unacceptably slow under most conditions.  By unacceptably slow I mean 1-2 seconds under conditions her 3 year old camera would focus on near instantaneously.  What happens is she presses the shutter button half way and then all the way thinking the pic will be in focus. It often isn't because the camera has not finished focusing.I had to show her that the camera's reticule turns green and the camera beeps and until that happens she should not press the button fully.  We were both amazed how long it took the camera to finish focusing.

Reviews.Title: Another AMAZON bargain!
Reviews.Author: JK's girl "Scullery Maid"
Reviews.Content: I had nothing but trouble with the previous digital camera I bought in 2008 from the competition.. The new NIKON is easy to use, takes a much better picture and fits in my purse. It is not too technical for me to be able to use.

Reviews.Title: Defective Battery Door
Reviews.Author: jdvnew "jdvnew"
Reviews.Content: Battery door was defective from Day 1 and paid to return it and was told it would cost $73.30 to repair--no warranty...on a defective product! Many others have reported this experience--will never buy another Nikon product.

Reviews.Title: camera nikon
Reviews.Author: vinotinto
Reviews.Content: i love my new camera, perfect conditions of the product, pictures look GREAT, the color its real nice, an excelent choice!

Reviews.Title: Broke within 6 months of purchase
Reviews.Author: Beth
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in December and it no longer worked by the time June rolled around. The small plastic tab that holds the batteries and the SD card in place broke off. Without the battery slot closed the camera won't turn on. I would have to tape around the camera to hold it closed to get it to work and un-tape it every time I wanted to take pictures off if I continued to use this camera. Overall it is too cheaply made to be worth your money. Invest in a better build camera.

Reviews.Title: Nice!!!!
Reviews.Author: Hunter
Reviews.Content: Nice camera. low quality lcd screen tho. the pics look like crap on the lcd but  when you uplad them, theyre good...... but i suggest the Kodak Easy Share.... 12mp that one is way better

Reviews.Title: Fast & Easy tp see
Reviews.Author: sooer12 "sooer12"
Reviews.Content: Had an old Kodak with dock and it was great...but this small easy to focus camera turns out sharp images ...but you must wait until the camera focuses perfectly to take the best picture possible...Once I got used to the second it takes to focus...everything was great.This camer is small and easy to carry around.I bought the case to avoid scratches and if dropped would not damaged the camera...

Reviews.Title: Not for Photography Hopefuls....
Reviews.Author: Alaina
Reviews.Content: If you are like me, and are interested in snapping some interesting pictures to use as inspiration for art or whatnot, then this camera isn't the greatest. I've noticed a lot of people talking about battery problems, also. Mine still works, but I have experienced battery trouble. If the batteries die and I put new ones in, it won't work. Usually it takes 2 or 3 different sets of batteries to make it work.My big problem is with the quality of pictures. It has a lot of settings to choose from, however when you have it on the right setting, the picture is always blurry. The close-up setting is the worst. You can stand so still, but it doesn't make any difference. I have missed so many great photo moments because the picture never turns out right. It usually takes about 5 tries until I give up. It will get you through a  special event or whatever, but if you want close-ups or moving shots...then you will be disappointed.I should have went with a Canon.

Reviews.Title: Great until Battery Door broke
Reviews.Author: Guac in Texas
Reviews.Content: I agree with other reviewers.  I really loved this camera model and even had my father get the same camera.  But the I now have the battery door secured with a rubber band after it broke off.  It broke before the camera was a year old.  I still like Nikon cameras though.  Just a cheaply made part brings this model down.

Reviews.Title: Picture quality is terrible
Reviews.Author: Suzi-G "Sue"
Reviews.Content: We have had nothing but trouble with the camera and even though we notified Nikon Technical Support immediately we are stuck with a terrible camera with pictures that have awful quality. The photo's are full of lines and totally not usable. We are still waiting for a resolution. Our case has been open with Nikon since 11/20/11. Very unhappy with this camera!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera - Fatal Battery Door Design
Reviews.Author: Mugwump
Reviews.Content: Topic says it all.  As others have noted, the cheap plastic design of the battery door makes this otherwise great camera a "no buy".  It wasn't long before I managed to break the flimsy clips on the battery door and now I must wire the door shut with a drilled hole and wire tie.The first time I opened the battery compartment I could tell that door wouldn't last.  It didn't.

Reviews.Title: OK but too bulky--blurry pix
Reviews.Author: Julio C. Martinez
Reviews.Content: good but not as great as the other NIKON I had--this one is too bulky--but it does not take good pictures-----good delivery by amazon

Reviews.Title: Not nearly as Cool as promised.
Reviews.Author: Feyno Tal
Reviews.Content: Why call it a "Coolpix" camera unless every pic you take is cool?  Almost 40% of the pictures I have taken would be described as "uncool" or "lacking the quality of cool" as my photography instructor put it.  Just look at the nice pictures posted on the page by MsLiss96.  They are indeed pretty, but hardly "cool".  I trusted Paul Simon, one of the coolest people ever (take that Garfunkel!), when he was all stoked about having a Nikon camera.  Maybe I have to get the Kodachrome model specifically.  Anyhow, since only about 60% of my pics are in fact "cool"  I give this product a 60% (3/5 stars) rating.

Reviews.Title: Horrible, avoid buying this camera
Reviews.Author: GetInvolved
Reviews.Content: This camera depends on batteries and there seems to be some weird problem with the connection to the power supply. The camera, even with new batteries, tells us it doesn't have enough power and shuts down. It was a gift for our daughter, what a huge disappointment for her and us.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Needs To Fix The Battery Door Latch!
Reviews.Author: David M. Stanwick
Reviews.Content: Broke, after only minutes of use!I bought this camera as part of a package which included an Ikelite underwater housing and external strobe.  Took a few photos on dry land and quickly filled the internal memory.  Bought an 8 GB SD card and then shot a few pictures while diving.  Nice little camera.  After getting home I left the camera on my desk for a few days.  Today I decided to put it safely back in its box, but the battery door kept flying open!  I naturally assumed that I hadn't latched the door properly.  But after fooling around with it for a while I can see that a tiny, almost microscopic, plastic tab that is part of the door latch is broken.  I was immediately disgusted that relatively heavy batteries being pushed by fairly substantial springs are exerting their combined forces against such a tiny little plastic tab!Talk about a weak link!  This puny little millimeter sized tab is supposed to handle the weight of the batteries and the force of the springs?  Not to mention the SD card, which also seems to be spring loaded.Even more surprising:  the number of customer complaints about this problem and Nikon's extremely poor customer-unfriendly response.Nikon, why do you keep doing this?  You want everyone to know that you sell top-professional gear, yet you sully your name with cheap crap like this.  I probably would be less upset if this happened two years after purchase, but this occurred, basically, after only minutes of use.I guess I'm going to have to resort to tape, which I'm hoping will work for me (some say it won't).

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix L24
Reviews.Author: Thomas J. Cuddy
Reviews.Content: I had the L22 before this and liked it. I gave that camera away and bought the L24. What a mistake. Other than pictures outdoors in bright sunlight, this camera is pretty much useless. Any pictures you take inside are a crap shoot. I just got back from a trip where I used the L24 to take some indoor pictures at a wedding and reception. I got about one good picture. It also takes too long to reset after a shot...so forget getting a couple of quick ones in a row. And the video quality is awful. I would NOT recommend this camera to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Nikon COOLPIX L24 14 MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: I.Q.
Reviews.Content: This is my first camera ever to own and use. I had to purchase this camera for microbiology class for taking pictures of bacteria. The pictures came out better than what I expected. Especially when I had to take some pictures through the lens of a microscope. It has a bunch of different features depending on the type of setting you want to take the picture in whether it's close up, a poritrait, light, or dusk, with many more. Came with a usb so I was able to connect it straight to my computer without installing anything. If you want to tune up the picture then you can install the software. Also, buy a memory card because the internal memory can hold about 2 pictures.

Reviews.Title: I've had better
Reviews.Author: M Kiss
Reviews.Content: It's a standard digital camera. This is a replacement for a CoolPix that died after many years of use and abuse (sorry I don't remember the old camera model number). I was hoping for a camera of similar quality that could take the abuse the old one did. This one so far seems flimsy compared to the old one. My biggest complaint is its inability to take photos when it counts. If the camera is set to "Easy Auto", the camera apparently has a hard time focusing and deciding what mode to switch to. When it does this, it takes so long; I very often miss a good shot. I also get very frustrated with it sometimes. My friends are very familiar with the phrase, "I hate this  camera!" I wish I had a different one.I gave it three stars because, even though I get very frustrated with it a lot of times, it does take good photos. When it works it works very well. If you need it to take photos quickly I would consider a different camera. Its auto focus is not very smart. If the scene is not in focus, it won't let you take the photo.

Reviews.Title: COOLPIX IS SERIOUSLY COOL
Reviews.Author: HR BRACK
Reviews.Content: Had a Sony Cyber-shot that was nothing but problems -- you couldn't see the screen in daylight so you couldn't tell what you were looking at and it was a battery hog!  This Nikon Coolpix is SO MUCH easier to use, very intuitive in operation, very easy to resize pics for the purposes you want with resolution up to 14 mp -- AND it takes short movies -- AND the batteries seem to last 10 times longer than the Sony.  So very happy that I made the switch!!

Reviews.Title: Nikon Cool Pix L24
Reviews.Author: Susan
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera and after the Coolpix L22 battery compartment corroded from bad batteries, I decided to keep with the same brand, only an upgraded model. I like that the batteries came with it also. Minuses? I wish the instructions were a bit clearer; I had to play around with the settings to get what I wanted. That's why I gave it 4 stars instead of 5.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera...Hard to beat a Nikon...
Reviews.Author: CrankyOldFart
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have had one of these(older model) for a year or two.  We love it soooo muuuch that we bought our twenty something daughter one when her camera disappeared (somebody needed worse than her I guess).  She couldn't believe how easy it was to use and how much it does.  Great pictures, video, and sound, and soooo many features!  Nikon makes the best cameras out there, hands down!

Reviews.Title: Great camera-Great Price !
Reviews.Author: Tom Oakes "serialman"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera mainly to photograph coins for Ebay because I needed closeup for detail . This camera takes great pictures at any distance and the Amazon price was about 20.00 lower than Walmart. The only negative was not the camera but the instruction manual was on disc and ,to me, hard to reference and so long that it would take alot of paper and ink to print. The camera is well worth the price!!!

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: Jasonthecomedian
Reviews.Content: I travel and take a lot of pictures.  This camera for under $100 does a great job.  It's easy to load them on my computer and add to my Facebook too.  It's not the greatest quality pictures, but if you just want a good picture and an easy to use camera I'd go with this one.  I bought the memory card and a case for under $106 total.

Reviews.Title: Takes great pictures for my photobooks
Reviews.Author: DBrown
Reviews.Content: I love making photobooks for my family events.  My older camera often had blurry pictures and they were not usable.  I decided to upgrade so that I didn't lose my family memories!  This camera has worked great.  Now I can fill up my photobooks for years to come.

Reviews.Title: Can't wait to toss this camera!
Reviews.Author: akorn
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera thinking Nikon has a great reputation and it would be a nice little camera to have- wrong. For those of you saying that you get crisp clear pictures PLEASE tell me what settings you use. For the life of me I can not get consistent clear photos. I have tried every setting and even put everything back to default but the lag time from when I snap the picture to when it actually takes is soooooooo slooooowwww!!! We have a 5 month old and I love taking pictures of her laughing and rolling but I capture very few moments with this camera because it is so slow!! I use my EVO camera and get better results! I am so dissapointed with this camera! Every time I try to capture those moments with my daughter and it fails me I want to throw it across the room! Unless someone can tell me what I am doing wrong this camera is getting thrown out! I do not recommend this camera at all, and since this was my first Nikon I think I will avoid that brand completely.

Reviews.Title: ~MY CAMERA SO ROCKS!!!~
Reviews.Author: Sista Sunshine
Reviews.Content: I SO LOVE THIS CAMERA! IT HAS BEEN AMAZING FROM DAY ONE AND I HAVE TAKEN WELL OVER 300 PLUS PICS WITH IT! IT UPLOADS SUPER QUICK TO MY LAPTOP AND I UPLOAD THEM STRAIGHT TO FACEBOOK! THE CAMER TAKES CLEAR & CRISP PHOTOS. I DO NOT TRAVEL ANYWHERE WITHOUT MY NIKON COOL PIC. IT IS MY VERY FIRST DIGITAL CAMERA AS I HAVE ALWAYS WANTED ONE AND I AM SO HAPPY TO HAVE THIS ONE. IT ALSO DOES WONDERS WITH VIDEO RECORDINGS...I RECORDED A FASHION SHOW AT THE SISTERHOOD SHOWCASE AND IT WAS DIVINE!!! AND THE PRICE WAS VERY REASONABLE...ALMOST UNBELIVABLE...AND SHIPPING WAS TOP NOTCH ARRIVED EXACTLY WHEN THE SAID IT WOULD...BEFORE THE DATE ACTUALLY! I LOVE AMAZON & I LOVE MY CAMERA...I LITERALLY GET SICK WHEN MY BATTERIES DIE! I WOULD RECOMMEND THIS CAMERA TO EVEYONE...EVERYWHERE!!! ~PEACHY KISSES~

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix L24
Reviews.Author: Phyllis Hacker
Reviews.Content: I'm really disappointed in this camera.  I returned a new HP camera I bought that was broken and purchased this as a replacement.  Instead of being broken it's just a horrible camera.  My pictures come out yellow or blue tinted no matter what setting I use.  The only decent pictures are outdoors or in natural afternoon light.  Forget taking photo's indoors after dark since the camera can't take a picture in room light.  If you don't have Photoshop to try to fix the colors in your pictures don't buy this camera.

Reviews.Title: More than a camera - it is a NIKON!
Reviews.Author: Cornelius B. Henning "Neels Henning"
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift for my daughter who needed a light and transportable camera to take picture outdoors for her work as a graphic designer. It turned out to be a very good choice. She has now used it for about 6 months and it never disappointed her. She particularly likes the idea that it is powered by readily obtainable AA batteries. No need to worry about lugging a battery charger along every time she ventures out with the camera. This is a great feature for her, in addition to the astounding quality of the pictures it takes. It is more than a camera. It is a NIKON! And at a reasonable price too!

Reviews.Title: Cheap!  Don't Buy!!!
Reviews.Author: A. M. Williams "Big Valley Nut"
Reviews.Content: My fiancee bought my coolpix L24 for me for my birthday in January.  In the beginning I loved it.  First of all it was beautiful, the color was cranberry red one of my favorite colors.  After using it a few times I loved it even more because it was easy to use and took great pictures.  However, after about 3 uses, the battery compartment door would pop open every time I used it and the batteries would fall out on the floor.  It was so embarrassing!!  I would line people up to take pictures and every time I aimed the camera to shoot the picture, the batteries fell out!!!!  This is clearly a design flaw.  Many people have complained about this problem and Nikon refuses to own up to their mistake.  Don't waste your money on this camera unless you want to be embarrassed like I've been so many times.

Reviews.Title: One more with battery door problems
Reviews.Author: A. Batie
Reviews.Content: I should have taken it back as soon as I realized how lame the battery door operation was.  I made the mistake of thinking that "ok, I've got it figured out now, it'll be ok".  Nope: 6 months later, it's broken.  It still closes...for the moment...but one corner doesn't latch, so it won't be long.  If you do get one (it's otherwise a nice camera, especially for the price), be careful when closing the door that it is slid all the way out, then press down fully so the door is completely flush with the case, *then* slide it in to close.  If you've done it right, there will be a very audible click that is distinctly louder than when you do it wrong. When opening, it much easier: slide the white latch button towards the back of the camera, then while holding it there, slide the door to the side and it will spring open as you release pressure on it.

Reviews.Title: pretty good .
Reviews.Author: TumblrLove<3
Reviews.Content: I liked this camera it has good quality and a great price, but the battery slot is very sensitive so if you tend to open it a lot and are not careful it can break really easily my top broke so i just taped it but it still works fine. It is sensitive when it comes to dropping it , I just dropped it once and it got scratched, i recommend a case. Overall its a pretty good camera . (:

Reviews.Title: Very Poor Construction
Reviews.Author: Pat H
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Coolpix L24.  I do not take pictures a lot but wanted to have an affordable camera in case I wanted to take a picture.  Biggest problem is the construction of the batteries and the disk being in the same compartment.  Batteries do no have to be changed too often but I like to take the disk out and see the pictures on my computer or television.  The pressure on the plastic door from the batteries caused the door to break.  I sent my camera back to the company and received a letter stating that it would cost me $29.00 to repair plus $12.50 to ship it back to me plus $2.03 tax for a grand total of $43.53.  I only paid about $100.00 for the camera to start with.  They would only give me a 6 month guarantee on the camera after it had been repaired.  I would definitely NOT recommend this camera to anyone.  Very poorly constructed.

Reviews.Title: Consumes battery power quickly, poor pictures?
Reviews.Author: Evan Gillespie
Reviews.Content: I'm not impressed with the "Nikon COOLPIX L24 14 MP Digital Camera with 3.6x NIKKOR Optical Zoom Lens and 3-Inch LCD."  Unfortunately, our unit consumes the entire power in the two "AA" batteries quickly.  After 50 pictures are taken and reviewed new batteries must be installed.Also, it doesn't seem to take good pictures.  There are a lot of modes the camera could be put into depending on the scene, and the camera does need to be put into a specific mode to take a picture.  The "auto" mode doesn't seem to work as well as a similar digital camera I bought years ago.If you need a camera that takes a quick shot, this camera isn't it.  By the time I've replaced the batteries and put the camera into a specific mode, my shot is usually long gone.I can't recommend this camera as it is only "adequate".  We purchased it to replace our aging Kodak camera, which sadly does a better job!

Reviews.Title: Latch broke after 2 weeks
Reviews.Author: Carla
Reviews.Content: Do yourself a favor before you buy any Nikon and do a quick search on the camera you're looking at along with the word "Latch". The latch issue appears to be occuring with several of their cameras.

Reviews.Title: Great deal
Reviews.Author: Phil
Reviews.Content: Great camera, great price, good features and easy to use.  If you can get a good price on this go for it

Reviews.Title: Worst Camera I Have Ever Used
Reviews.Author: HC
Reviews.Content: My mom bought this camera a few months ago. When mine was stolen, I had to start using hers to take photographs of products. It takes forever to get a focused clear photograph even when the settings are altered. My work takes 3x as long now because it's so hard to get a clear photo. It also tends to change the colors. I've used a lot of cameras in the past few years, but honestly none is as bad as this one.

Reviews.Title: My Niece Loves It.
Reviews.Author: B. Mc ALLISTER "Bryan"
Reviews.Content: I got this for my niece for a Christmas present.  She loves it.  She takes it with her everywhere.  I am told it works great.  Her first camera. She is 10 years old. Perfect for her.It arrived on time as promised.

Reviews.Title: Unacceptable
Reviews.Author: Nicholas "Nicholas"
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased this camera on Amazon for a friend, and I have to throw in my two cents.  The same thing happened to us that many others have already mentioned here.  Within a week of purchase the battery door fell open on its own, and it continues to do so on a regular basis.  On more than a few occasions the batteries have fallen out just in the process of taking a picture.  In addition to the faulty battery door, the photos are less than great.  This camera works poorly in any situation that doesn't have perfect lighting conditions.  I've had much better experiences with other similarly priced digital cameras.  Frankly, I don't understand how Amazon is continuing to allow Nikon to sell such a defective product.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: CJ
Reviews.Content: This is my second Coolpix. I left the first one in a taxi in DC and immediately ordered another one from Amazon. I worked as a photographer for many years during the "film" era and cannot believe the picture quality I get from this little camera. It fits in my pocket or purse, weighs practically nothing and takes videos too! Can't beat it for the price.

Reviews.Title: PIECE OF CRAP!
Reviews.Author: Johnny B
Reviews.Content: Do yourself a favor and spend a couple of extra bucks to buy yourself a Kodak or Canon if you would like a camera that lasts more than a year.  After just a couple of months of owning my Nikon Coolpix camera, I got a lens error in which the lens would pop out, then pop right back in.  I sent it in for repair and Nikon fixed it for no charge, but then a couple of months later, I had the same problem.  Only now they were charging me since the one yr warranty was over...and the charge is more than the price of the camera itself!  So my only word of advice, if you want a camera that won't break on you in a few months, treat yourself to a more reliable camera.OH, and don't expect any sympathy from Nikon...all I basically got was a "warranty's up, too bad".

Reviews.Title: Candy's Corner
Reviews.Author: tigerlady59
Reviews.Content: i have had my camera for little less then a month and have enjoyed a lot. it is similar to the camera i used to have but it takes more pictures and makes the images a lot sharper.

Reviews.Title: Coolpix camera is cool.
Reviews.Author: F. B. ""Lady Rancher""
Reviews.Content: This camera for the price is everything its advertised to be and more. For a point and shoot the images are very good. With the adjustable pixel setting you have control over quality as well as quantity of images with this little gem. We would say great buy for a travel camera.

Reviews.Title: Not a bad camera, but Nikon can do much better
Reviews.Author: Ricardo Lopes "IT Manager"
Reviews.Content: This is definately not a bad camera, but being familiar with Nikon higher end cameras makes it obvious that Nikon should do a much better job with this smaller cameras.  The image quality is good depending on the light, unfortunately it does not do a very good job in situations where the surrounding light is not at its best.To me this was disapointing because my higher end Nikon cameras do an amazing job in such a situation.  I am hopping that someone in Nikon listens to customers and really improve their coopix line.  Otherwise they will just make average cameras, and end up afecting their entire line of products.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't live up to the Nikon name
Reviews.Author: L Carpenter
Reviews.Content: I wanted to understand all the camera functions, which sounded very useful, so I spent 3 hours the day I purchased it reading the User Guide and taking notes before using it.  Right out of the box, the flash worked only intermittently, most pictures were blurred, and using the special modes made no difference in the washed-out picturees taken in strong light. I spent another hour re-reading the manual and troubleshooting to make sure I wasn't doing something wrong.  Satisfied the camera was defective, I returned it and was told by the camera department (which carries all of the major brands) that this model is the one most frequently returned, both because of the flash problem and because many persons find it sets up and focuses too slowly on automatic and is too complicated.  He recommended the comparable Canon, for the excellent macro close-ups and low-light photos without flash, two features we use a lot.  Ended up buying the PowerShort SX150 IS for the 12x digital zoom, along with most of the extra features the Nikon had.

Reviews.Title: Not a camera for indoor, "flash-off" pictures
Reviews.Author: C. Hays "carerocknroll"
Reviews.Content: I liked the overall feel of this camera until I realized that many of the pictures I was taking were not clear.1. Pictures taken outdoors in natural lighting turn out very clear and detailed and look great.2. Pictures taken indoors with the flash on also turn out fine.3. HOWEVER, Pictures taken inside without the flash tend to turn out blurry or at least not nearly as clear as those taken with the flash, no matter how much I change the settings and troubleshoot.If you just keep the flash on for all your pictures typically, the camera would be fine. If you like taking lots of pictures without the flash on, I would not recommend this camera.As other reviewers have noted as well, some of the pictures taken indoors tend to have a 'yellow' glow to them, which can be remedied by changing the settings but is extremely annoying to change everytime you want to counteract said glow.

Reviews.Title: piece of junk
Reviews.Author: coral
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera on Sept. 27 and on Oct. 8 it no longer worked.  The lens moved out as if the camera were on and stayed there, even when no batteries were in the camera.  I don't know if Nikon produced this piece of junk of if Amazon bought knock-offs.  But, Amazon did refund my money quickly and with no hassle.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: celticgirl
Reviews.Content: This is a replacement camera and I love it. It is simple to use, takes good pictures and one does not have to worry about a battery dying and not being able to use it.  Because it is powered by AA batteries, it is a simple matter of taking out the old batteries and putting in new ones.

Reviews.Title: Don't hesitate a great camera for a great price!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Books R Me!"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. I've had a lot of shoot and point cameras, but I have to say this is the best I've had. Especially on it portrait or micro setting. I needed a camera to take close up of art projects, and this does a great job of capturing my detailed work.Don't hesitate a great camera for a great price!!

Reviews.Title: super item
Reviews.Author: M. Corwin
Reviews.Content: This camera is perfect for my daughter who has three small children -  easy to operate and stash in her purse or diaper bag.  Great photos! This is our third purchase of Nikon's compact digital over the years - recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: NIKON Coolpix L24
Reviews.Author: T. S. Borek "Ted B."
Reviews.Content: Our original Nikon camera broke and we needed a quick replacement while it was being repaired.  We ordered the L24 because of the low price ($85)and immediate availability.  What a surprise !  it is a great camera. Small enough to carry around, 14.2 megapixels, excellent screen visibility andvery  easy to use.  We have our more expensive camera back but now carry the L24 with us wherever we go !  Great purchase for sure!

Reviews.Title: Coolpix rules!
Reviews.Author: jc
Reviews.Content: This is great, easy to use camera that is compact enough to fit in your pocket yet yields good, high resolution photos. That it uses AA batteries is also very handy. The view screen is a good size and is easy to see in all but the most difficult light conditions.

Reviews.Title: Returned CollPix L24
Reviews.Author: Robert Joseph Martinez Jr. "D70S Guy"
Reviews.Content: Kudos to Amazon for making it so simple and easy to return a defective item and receive a new replacement.The replacement CoolPix L24 works like a charm and like the Nikon product I had originally expected.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Lovey-momof3
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love the camera. Takes good pics of good quality. Didn't need to see the manual, it's so easy to operate.

Reviews.Title: Good simple camera, decent pictures
Reviews.Author: G. Horton
Reviews.Content: This is a decent, simple camera that produces good pictures for my personal needs. It probably isn't for a more demanding photographer.

Reviews.Title: Frustrated to Tears
Reviews.Author: Melmac
Reviews.Content: I was traveling by plane for a week long event, and I decided I didn't want to take my bulky Nikon D50. I invested in what I thought would be a great little point-and-shoot camera. I was SO wrong. I knew it wouldn't make pictures as great as my D50, but the quality was unbelievably bad. Honestly, I've gotten better pictures from disposable cameras! The few pictures I took outside were okay, but I spent the majority of the week indoors at a chorus convention. I tried every setting on the camera, and STILL couldn't get a decent shot. If the lighting was low, the picture was ridiculously blurry and noisy even with a flash. And if the lighting was good, the flash was so bright, everyone/thing in the picture was way overexposed. If I turned off the flash, the picture was blurry. I just couldn't win! The lag time between pushing the button and the picture actually snapping was worse on this camera than any I've ever used. If I could give it less than 1 star, I certainly would. I'm looking into returning this product to Amazon. I may be able to get my money back, but I won't get back the memories that I tried to capture. I'm so frustrated, I could cry.

Reviews.Title: BAADDD!
Reviews.Author: R. Pettaway
Reviews.Content: Thia is my second Nikon. I wasnt using it much. Finally on my trip to Brasil, I get error code; Lens error. It kept going in and out. Cheap, not much use, and this is the second time. Fix this problem Nikon!!

Reviews.Title: Great camera for non-tech savvy
Reviews.Author: Lucy's Mama
Reviews.Content: Wish I had bought this camera sooner.  I am not technically savvy at all and have only limited photos of my daughter since her birth because I had such trouble with our other camera.  This camera has been so easy for me to use.  Frankly, I haven't even pulled out the instructions yet - I just point and shoot.  I can zoom in and out and delete the photos that don't come out so great.  We used it this weekend on the beach and I think the photos came out extremely clear!  For someone who just wants an easy camera to take family photos, this is a great one!

Reviews.Title: It wasn't the best.
Reviews.Author: nancy
Reviews.Content: Within two days, the battery compartment latch broke, and so every five seconds, the batteries shoot out. The quality isn't that good either. All in all, I'm going to buy a new camera.

Reviews.Title: Poor Quality
Reviews.Author: RLNinCAL
Reviews.Content: Had the camera for about a year.  I chose the camera because I wanted a dry cell battery powered camera.  From the beginning the pictures never seemed quite right. Either too bright or dark when taken in auto mode.  The flash focus never worked consistently no matter what setting.  Seemed to have a mind of its own.  When taking a picture where there was sufficient light, the flash would go off creating a distorted picture with the unnecessary light.  Other times when I wanted the flash, it would not work.  The time it took to process pictures to the memory was excessive.  Finally, the camera would shut down with a battery exhausted message after just a few pictures were taken with new batteries.

Reviews.Title: coolpix bad battery
Reviews.Author: Cynthia A. Thornton
Reviews.Content: I loved this camera until it started rejecting any and all batteries! Nikon advised me to use non alkaline batteries which I did but it would sometimes work for one or two shots then say 'battery exhausted' even when I put in brand-new batteries! I will never buy another nikon Camera! What good are good pictures if you can't use the camera? Also it didn't work well indoors very well. I am bitterly disappointed because I had planned on keeping this camera for years! Boo Nikon!!!

Reviews.Title: I curse this camera every time I use it
Reviews.Author: Jemoon
Reviews.Content: Grant it I am not the most electronically savey person, but I curse this camera.  I got it as a gift, my last camera was a Kodak Easy Share, one of the older models, and I LOVED it.  But it was too big to carry around with me all the time so I asked for a little camera for my birthday and got the Nikon "cool"pix.  The only thing cool about this camera is it's size.  After the first 2 months of owning it the battery cover broke. And it was never dropped or man-handled. So I had to have a big ugly piece of tape on my brand new camera. I realized very quickly that this thing devoured energy.  I would put a new set of top of the line batteries in and after using it maybe a total of 2-3 hours, it was dead.  For this reason I switched to using rechargable batteries and it sucked the life out of them even quicker.  There is nothing more frustrating than thinking you have plenty of battery power and going to use your camera at a crucial moment and it dies on you.  And good luck catching those spontanious special moments that you leave your camera on and waiting for, like at a wedding or suprise birthday party or your childs first steps, because by the time it decides it's ready to snap the shot, the moment has long passed you by. To make a long story short, I wouldn't even GIVE this camera away after I buy a new one.  Just spend the extra 50-100 bucks and get something that won't make you curse like a sailor.

Reviews.Title: I agree, Junk, very disappointed in Nikon
Reviews.Author: ama-goin-shoppin
Reviews.Content: I took over 11,000 shots with my old Kodak and loved it. Simple, automatice and good pictures every time. I have a freind who works for Nikon so I thought I would give this a try...I was hesitant to write a bad review but I just keep getting more disappointed with this camera.The Nikon L24:My battery door also broke in a few short months. I have been using tape to hold it shut. The zoom lever also lost its spring and does not return to nuetral position on it's own. I am not anle to get a good outdoor picture at night at all, not even a hint of the image. The only good pictures are in natural in-direct light. even then duplicate images have different levels of exposure and color. For an automatic camera this unit has a mind of its own and its mind does not seem geared to taking good repeatable pictures.Please save yourself the aggrivasion and buy somthing else.

Reviews.Title: watch out!
Reviews.Author: H. ivanow "francophile"
Reviews.Content: though the camera is fantastically made for capturing images, the worst and worst of it is the battery door:  a tiny latch holding the spring loaded AA batteries in their compartment!!  once the latch weakens, say good bye to the camera.  might as well throw it away... i purchased a FUJI finepix F660EXR which has a very easy battery holding latch (only because the battery is a special type).  but this one has other inconveniences too... :-(

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: RichardFun
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my 75 year old father, and even though he's not really good with tech stuff he took right to it!

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT
Reviews.Author: Gladys clarke
Reviews.Content: I like everything about this camera pictures are sharp color good and the camera is with just aclick of the button very easy to operate

Reviews.Title: this camers was good
Reviews.Author: SonicTheHedgehog
Reviews.Content: it worked really well.I never had any problems with what so ever.I hope you guys will have more soon.

Reviews.Title: WARNING - BATTERY DOOR WILL FAIL ON ITS OWN
Reviews.Author: Bob Todd
Reviews.Content: AFTER A SHORT TIME I PICKED UP THE CAMERA OFF MY DESK AND THE BATTERY DOOR FLEW OPEN ON ITS OWN.  THE SPRINGS ON THE BATTERIES ARE SO STLONG IT BREAKS THE VERY SMALL LATCH.

Reviews.Title: Battery Door is junk on these
Reviews.Author: Bob J Perdue
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. In fact I love is so much I have owned 3 of them in the last 2 yrs. The camera is easy to use and takes great pictures. I am an ebay power seller and use this for my auctions. The thing on these cameras is the battery door is defective. If you use this camera several times a day and have to open the battery door to get the memory card out the latch will eventually snap. There is a cheapo latch where one pc of plastic goes under another. Very poor design. If you go on ebay you can see scads of these listed with broken battery doors. Nikon should have solved this problem years ago, but they haven't. There is too much downward pressure on the batteries.  If you are a person that is only going to use a camera on your summer vacation; this will work great for you. If you are a daily user of a camera steer clear of this. You will not be happy with the product. Mine is going back on ebay as broken and defective and I won't waste another cent buying the same model again!

Reviews.Title: GREAT PICTURES
Reviews.Author: Richard Bowman
Reviews.Content: EASY TO USE MY WIFE LOVES IT. THEN I DOWN LOAD ALL THE PICTURES AND PRINT THEM. THE BEST FEATURE IS THE DATE STAMP ON THE PICTURES SO THERE ISNT ANY PROBLEM WITH WHAT MONTH AND YEAR THAT IS ON THE PICTURES.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix
Reviews.Author: John Dagen
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my son and he really enjoys taking pictures with it.  He is still learning all the different programs on the camera.  I use it almost as much as he does due to the small size.  I can put it in my shirt pocket and take it anywhere. Easy to use and takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: evilsin66
Reviews.Content: Love this camera easy to use and transfer photos to your email, text, Facebook pictures come out great and fast

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Retired _NG
Reviews.Content: Camera has really worked well. I would reorder if I needed another one. Easy to use and memory card has plenty of volume.

Reviews.Title: Really Easy to Break
Reviews.Author: methylethel
Reviews.Content: Battery door, in the post-mortem analysis, seems to have been secured by two delicate plastic hooks. It's hard to tell now that both hooks have broken off, and the camera is no longer usable without some heavy-duty tape-- this is awkward though, because the location of the controls means you can't wrap the tape all the way around the camera for a secure hold, and you can't permanently seal the door, because you have to be able to replace the batteries. This isn't the first camera I've busted the battery door latch on, but it is the first one that had spring-loaded batteries to actively PUSH the door open and make it useless, once the latch busted. I used my old Lumix for a year with a broken battery door, and no trouble.Bottom line: if you're prone to dropping cameras, this one's not for you. Maybe look for one with a metal body. This one's all plastic.In addition, the only good pictures I got were in bright, but indirect, sunlight. That's pretty limiting. Direct sunlight leads to washout, and overcast or indoor lighting conditions mean the flash is mandatory-- everything is blurred and/or grainy without it.Probably you can't expect much more for the price, but I would gladly sacrifice half the megapixel capacity for a sturdier camera with a higher ISO. 14 MP is totally wasted when you can't take clear pictures in anything less than perfect light.

Reviews.Title: great for the begin!!
Reviews.Author: matthew Sanders
Reviews.Content: A great little point and shoot and easy to work, But the lens is a little fragile went it out. so Be careful!!

Reviews.Title: At least the battery door never broke.
Reviews.Author: William J. Robens
Reviews.Content: That's because I threw this piece of junk out well before any mechanical elements had the chance to degrade.After trying every conceivable setting, I found the camera truly excellent at capturing friends, dogs, monuments, landscapes, food, Christmas trees in a blurry and orange fashion. If that's your thing, it's ideal. But if you want to recognize your friends, family or pets or, I don't know, the Grand Canyon, you're better off using your phone or a charcoal sketch.For now, I'm going back to the 10mp Canon that's never taken a blurry or orange picture of anything.  And is older and cheaper. Stupid Nikon.

Reviews.Title: BATTERY EXHAUSTED PROBLEM
Reviews.Author: STEPHANIE H.
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera through Kmart. I have gone through three sets of batteries with this camera. After taking a few pics, I get a message that "battery exhausted" and it dies. I am not happy with this purchase and looking to take it back so disappointed because I'm missing things from my 3yr old that should be captured to share with his godmother and family members :(

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Bruno Ortiz Estupi
Reviews.Content: nikon is an excellent brand even for light equipment like this, very handy camera, easy to handle and very durable, no cons at all.

Reviews.Title: Wow, Fast Delivery!
Reviews.Author: George56
Reviews.Content: Camera came in 4 days from the date of ordering. Was in new physical condition and will be sending it to my son where he is. It was camera only and I put in batteries to make sure the screen was in good working condition and it was. I ordered it to replace a camera just like it that had a internal broken screen so we will see how it works with the other memory card. I'm sure it will be fine.

Reviews.Title: Broken camera door from first day. Take a pass
Reviews.Author: Haron
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera about 2 years ago and only just getting to review it. The batter door was broken from first day of use and I've only used it 2-3 times after sticking tape on it and holding it firmly while in use. Can get embarrassing when you ask someone to take a picture and the batteries slide out...garbage camera. Would not buy again had I read the reviews.

Reviews.Title: Best pocket camera I've ever owned.
Reviews.Author: Handy guy
Reviews.Content: Easy to use camera, high quality pictures, even in "PC mode" for emailing and a good value at $60.  I dropped mine, though.  Inevitable I guess, but now I must hold the battery hatch closed with a rubber band around the perimeter of the entire camera, as the tiny fragile plastic catch broke.  High quality images, intuitive controls and easy use, and long battery life - but somewhat fragile camera + butter fingers = a few swear words...

Reviews.Title: OK present, but I would've picked something else
Reviews.Author: CosplayerNikki
Reviews.Content: This camera was a present from my dad and his girlfriend.  Since it was free for me, it was pretty nice, I've had it for over a year now.However, most of my pictures without flash are very blurry.  Even some with the flash are blurry!  Or if I used my tripod, just pressing the button to take the picture was enough "movement" to make pictures blurry.  It does take good pictures, just not very often.Sometimes it stalls while I'm trying to take a picture too.  Which this is only a problem if it's something happening very quickly.  For example, when I'm at anime/sci-fi conventions I want to be able pull it out, take picture of a con-goer in a costume, then put it back so I don't inconvenience their con experience.Luckily I did *not* have the issue that others' did with the battery door breaking.  Mine is still working just fine, and I use rechargeable batteries so I take them out almost every time before I know I'll just my camera.When I buy electronics I do a lot of research, and since this was a present I was too excited to stop and think about how reliable it was--which was not reliable.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: consumer9277 "Geo"
Reviews.Content: Just purchased a refurbished model, own an L22; both have same battery door configuration.  If you read the directions, opening the battery door is a 2-step process: first slide the button, second slide the door.  Following the directions, closing is the reverse 2-step process.  My L22 door has functioned over 40 times for 3 years with with no problems and no sign of wear. It does burn up alkaline AA quite quickly: use Lithium AA.  The camera takes great pictures if you read the directions and learn how to use the various functions available.  If you really want a point-and-shoot, buy a throw-away at the drugstore.  Otherwise read the directions and this is a camera that can give you the results that it took over $400 to get 30 years ago.  Notice the recurring theme: Follow The Directions.

Reviews.Title: Fits
Reviews.Author: Terri W.Gore
Reviews.Content: This camera fits my Ikelite underwater housing. I flooded one so this so my second one, I would like to move up in quality but that is not an option.

Reviews.Title: don't buy it
Reviews.Author: William J. Cody
Reviews.Content: lasted a little over a year and then the battery door broke.  a weak design or just designed to fail.  avoid the aggravation and go with a quality product.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera for underwater use
Reviews.Author: Robert S. Mason "Bob Mason"
Reviews.Content: First one I had got flooded in error.  Very happy with this replacement that fits the underwater case I have.  I said something initially about Wifi but this camera does not have that feature nor need it.

Reviews.Title: returned
Reviews.Author: susan p isaac
Reviews.Content: I returned this item, because it is not really what I was looking for. I wanted a touch screen camera

Reviews.Title: I Guess it is okay, I don't really want it though
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "aprbaby"
Reviews.Content: I haven't had the camera long when the battery door broke on me. It takes great pictures when focused (but that is not often) The best non-blurred photos tend to be whe the flash is on, and the flash is very bright and tends to ruin lots of photos. It also eats batteries. I suggest you not buy this product.

Reviews.Title: Battery door broke - now unusable\
Reviews.Author: bejoki
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera in 2011 - July -after  two years the door broke on the battery compartment - and so now is completely unusable - Nikon needs to put a better door on it that will not break.  I guess these days two years is about normal huh?  The pictures are pretty good but it blurs quite easily if you are not really careful to stay totally still.

Reviews.Title: does this camera the l24  take videos ??
Reviews.Author: EITRA
Reviews.Content: DOES ANYONE KNOW IF THIS CAMERA CAN TAKE VIDEOS AND IF SOWHAT IS THE PROCEDURE, THANKS  EITRA.. THANKS AGAIN FOR ANY ADVICE CAMERA SEEMS TO WORK FANTASTIC..

Reviews.Title: excellent
Reviews.Author: patrice  cleare
Reviews.Content: love it even doe it was a use products.. it in excellent condition!!!! i will recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: Works Great!
Reviews.Author: Leslie Teachout
